A: Read the passage and answer the questions that follow:
1. Who was the stone cutter dissatisfied with? (a) His family (b) Himself (c) His boss
2. What did he see through the open gate? (a) Poor people (b) Fine cars (c) Animals
3. Why was he envious? (a) Wealth (b) Health (c) Family
4. What did he enjoy when he became the trader? (a) Hard work (b) Luxuries (c) Poverty
5. Why did he want to become a high official? (a) Power (b) Wealth (c) Health
6. What prevented the sun from shining? (a) Wind (b) Cloud (c) Rain
7. What pushed the cloud away? (a) Wind (b) Sun (c) Rain
8. What was more powerful than the wind? (a) Stone cutter (b) Cloud (c) Rock
9. Who is the most powerful in the story? (a) Sun (b) Stone cutter (c) Rock
10. What lesson did you learn from the story? (a) Be greedy (b) Be contented (c) Be poor
